adjective.description: Serving as a sign or indication of something.
examples: having recurrent dreams is not necessarily indicative of any psychological problem

adjective.description: Denoting a mood of verbs expressing simple statement of a fact.

noun.description: A verb in the indicative mood.

origin: Late Middle English: from French indicatif, -ive, from late Latin indicativus, from the verb indicare (see indicate).
